title: Hyosung Group chairman summoned by police
text:
Cho Hyun-joon

Cho Hyun-joon, chairman of Hyosung Group, a major textile and industrial materials conglomerate, was summoned by police on Wednesday to answer questions about allegations that he embezzled company funds.Cho, 51, arrived at the Korean National Police Agency in Seodaemun District, western Seoul, at around 7 a.m. and the questioning was ongoing as of 8 p.m. press time.Police officers believe Cho embezzled money from Hyosung to pay top lawyers he hired for criminal cases he was involved in as a suspect.Officers on Wednesday were expected to grill Cho on whether he actually used company funds to cover his legal expenses, and if so, whether he was directly involved in making that decision.While it is not precisely known how much Cho allegedly embezzled, police officers cited a Supreme Court ruling saying that a chairman of a company cannot pay lawyers he or she hired for a personal civil or criminal case with corporate funds.Police have been looking into the embezzlement suspicions of Hyosung Group since last year. Sources with knowledge of the case said Hyosung allegedly hired lawyers who used to work as high-level prosecutors to help the group’s chairman and his family deal with a number of legal cases mostly linked with embezzlement.Officers believe Hyosung Vice Chairman Lee Sang-woon was aware of the illegal transactions. Lee, 67, who isn’t a part of the Cho family, was still summoned as a suspect on Oct. 14 on allegations of helping the family embezzle corporate money.Hyosung Group’s Honorary Chairman Cho Suck-rai, 83, could be next in line to be summoned, though police officers say they might ask him to appear at a later date due to his poor health.The People’s Solidarity for Participatory Democracy, a local nongovernmental organization that advocates democracy and labor rights, filed a complaint against Hyosung’s chairman and honorary chairman with the prosecution in April, asking them to punish the father and son on charges of embezzlement, dereliction of duty and evasion of taxes.The group claimed that the duo siphoned nearly 40 billion won ($34 million) from Hyosung and six of its affiliates to pay their lawyers in legal cases.BY KIM MIN-WOOK [lee.sungeun@joongang.co.kr]
